alert.note: Alert for Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 5:28PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A cluster of heavy rain producing thunderstorms will impact portions of south central El Paso and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 615 PM MDT... At 525 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Fountain, or 17 miles south of Colorado Springs, moving northwest at 10 mph. Other heavy rain producing thunderstorms were developing over Ft Carson and along the I-25 corridor from Fountain southward to near Pinon. HAZARD...Brief torrential rainfall, and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Localized ponding of water on roads will be possible along with poor visibility under heavy downpours. Poor drainage areas may briefly experience some localized flash flooding. Locations impacted include... Fountain, southern portions of Ft Carson and I-25 from Fountain to 6 miles north of Pinon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet
